articles.author: Graeme Wearden
articles.title: FTSE 100 nears record high as inflation fears ease - The Guardian
articles.description: Blue-chip stock index ends week 1% off all-time best as markets across Europe rise amid falling energy prices
articles.content:
The UKs FTSE 100 share index approached a record high on Friday, as European markets were lifted by hopes that the inflation shock from energy prices is easing.
The blue-chip stock index, which incl… [+3639 chars]

articles.author: Angela Giuffrida
articles.title: 'Dangerous' Irish plan for alcohol health warnings prompts anger among Italian winemakers - The Irish Times
articles.description: Ireland is free to go ahead with cancer and liver-disease warnings after a deadline passed for the European Commission to oppose them
articles.content:
A plan by Ireland to put stark health warnings on bottles of wine, beer and spirits has caused anger in Italy.
Ireland is free to go ahead with the measure, which would warn consumers about the risk… [+2587 chars]

articles.author: David Kelly
articles.title: Conor Murray dropped from matchday squad as Munster name team for Northampton clash - Independent.ie
articles.description: Conor Murray’s World Cup hopes have been dealt a major blow as, in an eerie echo of his own dramatic World Cup breakthrough in 2011, he has been dumped from Munster’s European squad to face Northampton.
articles.content: Conor Murrays World Cup hopes have been dealt a major blow as, in an eerie echo of his own dramatic World Cup breakthrough in 2011, he has been dumped from Munsters European squad to face Northampton… [+2133 chars]

articles.title: Ross Byrne returns at out-half in strong Leinster XV for Gloucester trip - The42
articles.description: Cian Healy in line to win his 100th European cap at Kingsholm on Saturday.
articles.content:
ROSS BYRNE RETURNS at out-half in the Leinster starting lineup for Saturdays Champions Cup trip to Gloucester.

articles.title: Threat Assessment Brief: Implications for the EU/EEA of the spread of the SARS-CoV-2 Omicron XBB.1.5 sub-lineage - European Centre for Disease
articles.description: According to the current ECDC assessment, there is moderate probability of XBB.1.5 becoming dominant in the EU/EEA and causing a substantial increase in the number of COVID-19 cases within the next one to two months.
articles.content: The XBB.1.5 Omicron sub-lineage was first detected in samples in the United States (US) in October 2022. This sub-lineage has been growing in proportion in the US and many countries around the world … [+1863 chars]
